ratings.question_text: Ease of access to materials Ratings:
The difference between what you knew before and what you know after Ratings:
How well you understood the material Ratings:
How well you expect to retain it Ratings:
The extent to which you expect to use the insights you gained during your career Ratings:

narratives.question_text: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload
comments: A solid variety of course work that was not overbearing but challenging.
Workload felt minimal, but just enough to hold us accountable for preparing for class discussions.
The workload suited the course, it might have been interesting to have additional group work/assignments since so much of the class focuses on working with and managing others.
I enjoyed the amount of out of class work we did. I like the readings.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
comments: I'm not sure what the sequencing was, but perhaps that's the nature of this course - they are somewhat disparate topics and case studies. But there was certainly never a moment where we learned something and I thought, "This would have been good to know earlier in the semester."

Course was organized but it would have been helpful to tie each discussion topic back into an overall course sequencing; many things felt like standalone topics when they are really innately tied together.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:
comments: This instructor was wonderful and I highly recommend taking any of these courses to all disciplines within theater.

Vicki's experience is vast and her anecdotes are illustrative and often entertaining. Her attention to the current conversations about EDI were extremely helpful in keeping the class informed and open-minded not only about how Vicki's career has gone, but where the field is going in best practices. Sometimes we spent too much time gathering details on the white board before jumping into the difficult conversations - I think we can trust that we have a grasp of the details and their complexities and just jump into learning from Vicki's wisdom!
Instructor was clear and provided excellent real-world examples.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on: Visitors, if any
comments: It was great to have certain guests! I would even say we should have more if there is time!

All visitors were great. Such a joy to hear different viewpoints and learn from their expertise. I appreciated their candor and ability to share a solid overview of their topics in a limited amount of time.
Enjoyed our visitors, both helped clarify classroom topics.
The Management professor we had was excellent. Laura is such a great asset.
The visitors were always interesting, especially the lawyer.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
comments: Some of the material blurs together for me across our class discussions and assignments.
I have already used information I learned from the class in applying for summer positions. Thanks!

I would love to have the final presentation cleared up a bit more. There was a bit of confusion between myself and a few others as to what was expected and the specifics of what to conduct in our interviews.
I would change the course to very clearly delineate between each topic and how it ties into the overall course objectives and themes.
